I have Zen Pinball on Xbox 360, android and now iOS.  Why the low rating?  Because on 360 and android the game is responsive, but on iOS just about every time a ball drains it is because the flipper fails to activate when i press.  Pretty much makes the game unplayable, when every time the ball gets near a flipper you think, is this the time the game will fail?

If one holds the tablet comfortably resting on their palm, the thumbs tap the screen above the tapping zones so the flippers won‚Äôt work.

title.label: good pinball, app needs an overhaul

content.label: Come on, guys, hire a UX designer and a somebody to help with the coding of the app and interface for an overhaul. The pinball itself is great but getting to the game, switching tables or buying a new table is extremely frustrating. Trying to buy a table and it‚Äôs constant errors. It would also be nice if a purchased table was available across all devices tied to the same account rather than a separate charge for iOS, AppleTV and Mac. At least then there might be a reason to buy more than one or two.
We need new tables the ones I have are getting old am tired of players with them. Please can someone get new pinballs games. Thank you.

title.label: Zen pinball continues to amaze me

content.label: Every pinball game is so different and so full of awesome surprises,I keep taking screenshots to capture latest cool effect,quests,missions etc.Never was a "pinball person" spending hours and hours in the arcades over the years, I was always playing video games.But Zen has creatively merged both worlds in eye - popping style,now if I can just stop playing sometimes to sleep,lol....Very addictive.

I have all the Zen tables!   If you think the flippers fail, it‚Äôs because you aren‚Äôt pressing the correct area on the ipad. 
   Love the Zen!

I used to play a lot of Pinball from ‚ÄúPinball Arcade‚Äù until the whole Williams/Bally debacle. The great thing about their interface was you could demo any table until you hit a certain score. This is a great incentive to buy tables.

I hate the whole carnival atmosphere on your Williams Pinball (buying coins/earning parts) to get tables.  You should be able to buy tables or table packs and have access to a few ball skins (which makes playing a lot more enjoyable).

PS please make a Beavis and Butthead pin!

Otherwise a great experience.

I‚Äôm a huge pinball fan and have a variety of pinball games on my devices.

A few recommendations:

- Simplify the user interface: too much going on to select tables. Previewing is a royal pain. Needs ability to test tables.

- table cleanliness: there‚Äôs a lot going on the tables. By more importantly, the texture ol tends to be blurry.

- controls: iPhone controls don‚Äôt work very well. The left flipped control works/doesn‚Äôt work intermittently

Desperately needs PS4/Xbox/mfi controller support.  I‚Äôd even settle for iCade support like the competition.

The price is right, given the quality of the tables, but the controls don‚Äôt work properly. When I press near the bottom of the screen, the flippers don‚Äôt work. Happens on multiple tables. Played on an iPhone 6S and probably won‚Äôt be playing again until this gets fixed.

title.label: Login Issue with Fire TV App

content.label: The game itself and individual tables are amazing! I've bought every table over the year. The Deadpool table is great but his voice is annoying as hell; so is him moving around the table so I avoid Deadpool. Lastly, you can't login on the Fire TV app. I've got every Apple device there is but I'm certainly not going to re-purchase all the tables. Amazon and Apple need to start getting along so these issues can be fixed! When that happens I'll rate this at 5 Stars for sure.
Tables are a buck or two apiece and there‚Äôs a LOT to choose from.  I love it.

Edit:  Still Nothing...

I have been playing Zen Pinball for years; I own every table and have found myself in the top 10 on few leaderboards.  It is sad to see this app seemingly abandoned.

It has been two years since the iPhone X came out and introduced our new resolution.  Zen hasn‚Äôt made the effort to update the game to fit the new resolution and not only do graphics suffer for it, but controls are not as responsive as they should be.  Resolution aside, the game hasn‚Äôt been updated in many months.

It is sad that Zen couldn‚Äôt figure out how to release the Pinball FX platform on iOS with all the great tournament modes.  It is sad that Zen seemingly has no interest in updating the game as it is.  It is sad that Zen Pinball seems to have been abandoned in favor of the micro transaction-based abomination that is the Williams app, which really should have either been integrated into Zen Pinball or a mobile implementation of Pinball FX.

When functioning and updated, Zen Pinball is the cream of the crop.  As it is, I am left wondering if e app is completely dead and I would hesitate to recommend it to anyone.
App should work with the keyboard, i.e. flipper should operate via shift keys. Using the touch screen for flippers isn‚Äôt fun.

I have a lot of your tables on my Android phone... I was hoping to pick them up and share them with my family using iPhones/IPads via family sharing... I don‚Äôt mind paying for a port to a different OS due to the work involved, but unfortunately you only allow in-app purchases ( I‚Äôm assuming to avoid the apple money grab) which circumvents family sharing.  It would be nice if you allowed us to share the tables with family members...maybe by letting us link up to 4 apple id‚Äôs...  The individual game purchases like archer seem to work with sharing.

title.label: Needs a larger space on the screen for the flippers.

content.label: Developer I've played your pinball many times, even bought tables on another platform. My hands are large any my fingers miss the flippers a lot. You should increase the space on the flippers to half the screen. Or at least have an option to modify it.
